intro: Aleuritia bayernii, commonly known as the Bavarian elder, is a deciduous shrub native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Adoxaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but often used more for ornamental purposes. Aleuritia bayernii typically grows to a height of 2–4 meters and prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. It is valued in gardens for its attractive foliage and seasonal flowering.
